{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms started after eating shellfish at a restaurant, and others who ate there had similar symptoms. This suggests a foodborne illness. Among the options, Calicivirus, Rotavirus, Adenovirus, and Norovirus, the most common cause of foodborne viral gastroenteritis in adults is Norovirus. Rotavirus is more common in children, while Adenovirus and Calicivirus are less common causes of foodborne illness.", "answer_choice": "D. Norovirus"}
